Reviews.Content: The worst place I've ever stepped foot in This place is awful. Its the stereotypical hostel, dirty filthy place with broken furniture, creepy staff working there, and weirdos staying in the place. The telltale sign was that they make you pay before you see the room - don't make this mistake!! I complained to the 'management' and was told what did you expect, a 5 star hotel??I don't have particularly high standards, and just wanted a cheap place to stay 2 nights, however this was awful, and as a girl I can tell you that this place gives me the creeps - sleep with 1 eye open if you do stay there. For only 10 euro more a night there are some much better hotels (not hostels) that will make your stay in Florence far more pleasurable.
Reviews.Author: filive

Reviews.Content: Great value in Florence This is a little hotel in Florence. Location is great - a few minutes from the station, and just outside of the main tourist area. Don't expect anything fancy, but it's a good value budget option that's clean and comfortable.
Reviews.Author: adam_in_sf

Reviews.Content: Yellow room with no windows OK bad room but excellent location - and we saw this really awesome room on the top floor which if you book i recommend you get. Its right on the corner of the building with windows on all sides with its own ensuite. The one free internet computer had a stuffed keyboard - but there is an internet cafe around the place.
Reviews.Author: Llewster

Reviews.Content: Not everything is perfect! We had a private washroom, which was big, but there was mold on the ceiling over the shower and the shower curtain was not clean either. Also, the towels weren't replaced the next day.This was advertised as a hotel on the website that we booked it on, but really it's a higher end hostel. Therefore, my thoughts are mixed on this place. For a private room, with one double bed, the room was spacious.Staff is friendly and helpful. Call if you are going to arrive late, so that they will be there to let you in. It is close to the train station, but the hotel sign is not obvious from the street. There is no internet connection, eventhough the website says there is. However, they will store your luggage for free, if you want to explore the City after you check out. That saved us money on having to store our luggage at the train station.If you arrive late on a Sunday night, no worries - there are plenty of places to eat close by so you don't have to get McDonalds at the train station. They close between 11pm to midnight.
Reviews.Author: KCToronto

Reviews.Content: Nice stay in Florence.....       open markets
Reviews.Author: Doxer

Reviews.Content: Fantastic for budget travellers This is a great place to stay for budget travellers. I stayed for 3 nights with a friend in a double room - with a shared bathroom (which is what worried me before I arrived). There was no need to worry - the bathrooms were always spotless (cleaner than many 4 star hotels in Europe with private bathrooms!) with fantastic showers. The owners were very friendly, and offered to keep our luggage at the hostel after we checked out, as we were catching a train later in the day. Also - the photos on the official website are old - the rooms and bathrooms have been renovated recently. Cannot recommend this place enough for people travelling on a budget.
Reviews.Author: jcperth

Reviews.Content: Cheap and nasty 10 min walk from main train station, but difficult to find (only indicated by number and small plaque on the front door), 15 min walk to historic centre.Very basic room with broken fixtures, no double glazing so cold and loud at night, no fire safety features apparent, not enough bedding. Mouldy, broken-tiled and flood-prone shower with chewing gum in it and broken window in bathroom fixed with tape. Cleaner smoked inside whilst cleaning room and in spite of no-smoking signs.
Reviews.Author: Neverkissacactus

Reviews.Content: Great hostel! My husband and I stayed for two nights, in a matrimonial bed room. It was great. The bathrooms were clean, with awesome showers. There was access to free internet. Inside the room was a hotpot for heating water, tea bags and instant coffee, a mini fridge and a flatscreen tv. A great place for people on a budget.
Reviews.Author: flightgoddess

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay This place is fairly cheap but you get what you pay. The location is close to the train station which could be good but on the other hand is on the loud street with no views. On the inside, this place is a hostel, wireless internet doesn't work but they do have computer with internet connection in the lobby. If you are really on the budget the place will do as air conditioner works, has hot water, and fairly central location with an ok size room. However, if you want a place to which you would like to come back after a tired day, i would chose something further from the train station with not so much noise (at least ask for a room that has windows away from the buzy Via Nazionale street).
Reviews.Author: vendetto69

Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay Our room was very clean and the owners were kind. The location was really great (super close to the train station and within walking distance of everything). Bonus=air conditioning in the room!! An airline strike caused us to miss our first night of the reservation, and the owners even worked out a deal despite us not cancelling within 24 hours. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is travelling to Florence!!
Reviews.Author: gorskikg

Reviews.Content: Under the Tuscan sun Soggiorno Gloria is basic, clean hotel close to the train station. The rooms could probably do with a lick of paint but the shared bathroom was always spotless. We found the staff very friendly and the location within walking distance of all the major attractions. There are plenty of surrounding street markets to haggle for a bargain and it鈥檚 close to the big Mercato Centrale food market 鈥?a great place to buy some fantastically fresh produce. Try the ZaZa trattoria for a yummy meal!
Reviews.Author: AustralianCouple

Reviews.Content: Great for College students/backpackers I stayed with my boyfriend for Spring Break. We were visiting friends from college who were studying abroad. The location is good, very close to San Lorenzo market. We walked everywhere and this was close to everything as well as the train station. We felt safe. The picture is not of the building. Rooms were good size for Europe. What we found funny was the bathroom, its one long tile hallway. When you opened the door there was a sink, in the middle of the hall there were 2 shower curtains to seperate the shower and the toilet was at the rear. We were only in our room to sleep and it suited us fine. Dimly lit rooms. The only complaint was construction outside our window in the morning. If you are an early riser this would not be a problem, however we partied everynight and would sleep in till about 11 a.m.For the price, this was a great budget hotel. Friends we visited came to the hotel and said it was a great deal for the room size. There is little signage outside and you enter into a dimly lit hallway. They do have elevators which is convenient for luggage. Overall, for the money it was a good deal since the hotel was not expensive. We were not expecting much and it was sufficient for showering and sleeping. They also had beverages available at the desk.Other friends from our school stayed in a quad room and for the price they agreed it was a great deal for college students.I would not stay here if you are expecting luxury or a nice hotel in comparison to the U.S. However, perfect for college students or someone on a budget just looking for somewhere to shower, sleep and keep your belongings safe.
Reviews.Author: michl813

Reviews.Content: Great stay for a great price We stayed in a room for three adults and found it to be clean, airy and spacious enough so as not to be claustrophobic. The staff were friendly and incredibly helpful. Soggiorno Gloria is in a great location near the main train station - we stayed for three nights, saw all the sights and didn't use public transport once. There were tea and coffee making facilities and pastries in our room, which was a pleasant suprise. There was also a television and hairdryer. It was a quiet room and we didn't hear any noice for adjoining rooms. It is a fantastic place to stay if you are looking for a nice place at a reasonable price (read cheap!) in a central location. We booked through Hostel World with no problems.
Reviews.Author: Kateski

Reviews.Content: not wheelchair accessible I had emailed the Hotel regarding accessability for a wheelchair user. They assured me it was accessible, so I booked. After wheeling back and forwards along Via Nazionale, I finally found the Hotel. It looked nothing like the photo on the internet - it is not on a corner. The only visible feature on the outside of the Hotel to identify it is a small plaque with Soggiorno Gloria written in blue! When I opened the entrance door, I was confronted with 3 large steps to negotiate before I could get to the lift! I was not impressed!! This Hotel is a definite avoid for those persons who cannot negotiate steps.The Hotel about 30m along the street, Hotel Corona, is an ideal place to stay, albeit dearer.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Soggiorno Gloria We were a family of four in a quad room . The room was of good size. Double bed and two singles,airconditioning and private bathrom across hall. Good location near termini. I can recommend Soggiorno Gloria .Ian
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
